entities.name: cedric diggory
entities.description: Cedric Diggory is mentioned as being in a comparison with Potter Stinks. This suggests that Cedric Diggory was someone notable or important to the narrator, Harry.

entities.name: potter stinks
entities.description: Potter Stinks is mentioned as being in a comparison with Cedric Diggory. This suggests that Potter Stinks was someone notable or important to the narrator, Harry.

entities.name: sneakoscope
entities.description: A Sneakoscope is mentioned as being worn out and cracked. It is described as an object that had been given to Harry by his godfather, Sirius.

entities.name: gold locket
entities.description: A gold locket is mentioned as containing a note signed R.A.B. It is described as an object that had been hidden inside the locket.

entities.name: r.a.b.
entities.description: R.A.B. is mentioned as signing a note that was hidden in the gold locket. This suggests that R.A.B. was someone notable or important to the narrator, Harry.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is mentioned as being Harry's godfather and giving him a Sneakoscope and an enchanted mirror. This suggests that Sirius was someone notable or important to the narrator, Harry.

entities.name: daily prophet
entities.description: The Daily Prophet is mentioned as being on top of which the fragment of the broken mirror was placed. This suggests that the Daily Prophet is a newspaper or publication that is important to the narrator, Harry.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is mentioned as being the one who discovered the broken mirror and was affected by its discovery. This suggests that Harry Potter is the main character of the story.

entities.name: enchanted mirror
entities.description: The enchanted mirror is mentioned as being given to Harry by his godfather, Sirius. It is described as being broken and its fragments causing harm to Harry.

relationships.description: Harry Potter compares himself with Cedric Diggory, suggesting that he is thinking about Cedric's death and its impact on him.
Harry Potter compares himself with 'Potter Stinks', suggesting that he is thinking about his own reputation and how it has been affected by the discovery of the broken mirror.
Harry Potter's godfather, Sirius, gave him a Sneakoscope and an enchanted mirror. This suggests that Harry and Sirius have a close relationship.
Harry Potter discovers a note signed R.A.B. in the gold locket, suggesting that he has a connection to R.A.B. through the object.
Harry Potter is affected by the discovery of the broken enchanted mirror, suggesting that he has a connection to the object through its damage.
